website_summaries.verdict: A slick, all-around trailer tire that provides a good balance of performance, durability, and value.
pros: Uses a multi-body ply rubber compound for longer life
Tread pattern is designed to dissipate heat buildup during long road trips
One of the few trailer tires rated for higher load capacities without extended wear
Variable pitch design makes for a quiet ride
cons: Tire can require extra assistance to properly install on a rim

customer_reviews.title: Good price, fresh stock
customer_reviews.text: Some sizes of RV tires have few manufacturers. Carlisle was *significantly* less expensive than the three other manufacturers of this size tire, even with shipping. RV tires typically "wear out" by date, not by tread depth. This merchant shipped tires with date codes only about three months past, which is about what you would expect from the best brick-and-mortar tire shops. Can't yet speak to actual mileage/wear on Carlisles, as ours are still new.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Bowman

customer_reviews.title: A good trailer tire for 65 plus mph!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this brand tire in 2017, and have drug my camper around for 3500 miles with them. Absolutely no problems. Wearing very well. What is surprising is that they hold up to being dormant for a month or two, and then go hit the road for a few hundred miles with no problem as far.
customer_reviews.author: Lance G. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes and was disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these, but they wear quickly and choppy. I've gone back to the cheaper Freestar tires which wear about twice as long and have never failed me. I like the tread design and the higher speed rating, but every one has cupped and exposed the fiberglass belts. All were balanced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 6 didn't make it the first year
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be great tires, but I've had two out of six blow in one year. The rest are already weather checked/dry cracking on the side wall. Maybe they hold up better if they stay covered but I have Goodyear's that are about 10 yrs old that still look better. I wouldn't expect to see the side walls do this for at least for years, I will go with Goodyear's next time. All tires had 2018 date codes.
customer_reviews.author: matt d

customer_reviews.title: Super duty tires!
customer_reviews.text: These 10 ply tires seriously helped the rear trailer fishtailing on the road. They also stood up to the rocky backroad in the mountains and high temperature highway with the fully loaded camping trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Rod Carter

customer_reviews.title: A good looking tire
customer_reviews.text: Have not had these on the road yet, but hoping they preform as well as those I installed on our previous camper. Over 5K miles and one could still read the 'CARLISLE' imprint in the center of the tread. These four and the previous set of four all balanced out with minimal to moderate weights added. All were only a few months from manufacture when mounted.
customer_reviews.author: fltengnear

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty trailer tires.
customer_reviews.text: . Very nice Carlisle trailer tires. Saved money buying them on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Miller

customer_reviews.title: Recommend trailer tire.
customer_reviews.text: Great tire. I use on my tandem axl boat trailer that is about 9.5k lbs. I wouldn’t use any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good date stamp and tire.
customer_reviews.text: 225/75r15 - 10 ply tires (Load Range E) Speed Rating M (81mph). Ordered on July 22nd 2020 and received on July 25th. Tire date stamp is 0720, so they in 3rd week of February 2020 or 5 months ago. Very happy with the tire and price.
customer_reviews.author: jessica walker

customer_reviews.title: Good tires
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Carlisle Radial Trail HD trailer tires for years without incident.
customer_reviews.author: Steven F. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these tires. Would not recommend trying to mount by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: ... did a 3500 mile trip and they look just like they did when I purchased them
customer_reviews.text: I just did a 3500 mile trip and they look just like they did when I purchased them. Worked perfectly, Great tire! I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Its a trailer tire, what do you think I used it as a yard planter 😳👍
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Dunagan

customer_reviews.title: Carlisle tires.
customer_reviews.text: Great tires! Have right around 4500 miles on them. Do not show abnormal wear.
customer_reviews.author: DAB/CMB

customer_reviews.title: Carlisle quality!
customer_reviews.text: As you would expect from a known brand. Good value and nice tires.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Carlisle Radials with 7500 miles and counting
customer_reviews.text: We have put about 7500 miles on these tires without issue. Inflated to the recommended 50 psi they show no signs of wear. We haul a mid sized sedan with the dolly over a variety of road surfaces from chopped up NE Interstate to gravel to hot weather FL interstate. We are hoping for a long tire and tread life.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

product_meta.title: Carlisle Radial Trail HD Trailer Tire - ST225/75R15
product_meta.description: Our focus with high-speed trailer tires is always on safety and protection, which is why we developed the Radial Trail HD -- the best radial trailer tire in the market. We have completely redesigned the industry-leading Radial TrailRH trailer tire for:- Improved tread wear, Greater heat resistance, Increased durability. In real world testing, the Radial Trail HD showed a 10% improvement in tire life over the Radial Trail RH, giving you a longer lasting trailer tire. Building the toughest trailer tire means we needed to engineer the inside to be as strong as the outside. Every component in the Radial Trail HD was updated to outperform the competition. Every component in the Radial Trail HD was optimized to reduce rolling resistance – extending tire life and increasing durability. So, whether you use your trailer for work, play or sport, the Radial Trail HD tire is the toughest and safest radial trailer tire on the market giving you increased peace of mind and protection.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars43 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
